DOCNAME: CASE OF ER AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (Article 35-1 - Six month period);Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Life) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Effective investigation) (Procedural aspect);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Inhuman treatment) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Lawful arrest or detention);Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy);Pecuniary and non-pecuniary damage - award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in Hakkari . The first CARDINAL applicants are the children of Mr PERSON , who disappeared in DATE , and the remaining CARDINAL applicants are his siblings . At the time of his disappearance PERSON Er was DATE .

CARDINAL . The facts of the case are disputed by the parties . The facts as presented by the applicants are set out in Section B below . The Government ’s submissions concerning the facts are summarised in Section C below . The documentary evidence submitted by the applicants and the Government is summarised in Section D.

CARDINAL . On DATE an armed clash took place between members of the ORG and members of the security forces in GPE village , which comes within the administrative jurisdiction of the town of GPE in south - east GPE . After the operation the soldiers took the applicants’ relative PERSON and an elderly relative by the name of ORG Er from PERSON to the nearby Işıklı gendarmerie station .
CARDINAL . DATE the applicants informed the public prosecutor in PERSON of the incident .
CARDINAL . Hacı PERSON was released on DATE but nothing further was heard from PERSON .

CARDINAL . The Government submitted that PERSON Er had not been taken into custody . He had assisted soldiers in searching for landmines planted in the area by terrorists and had been released following the ORG return to their barracks .
CARDINAL . An effective investigation carried out by the judicial authorities had shown that following his release PERSON Er had joined the terrorists in northern GPE .
CARDINAL . The following information emerges from the documents submitted by the parties .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON , who is the brother of PERSON and one of the applicants , informed the public prosecutor in PERSON in writing about the disappearance of his brother . He also stated that the family feared for PERSON life , and asked for the public prosecutor ’s help .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor recorded in a report that he had had a telephone conversation with Major PERSON of the LOC commando headquarters . Major PERSON was also the commanding officer in charge of the soldiers who had carried out the operation on DATE . The major told the public prosecutor that PERSON had been taken from the village by his soldiers on DATE to help them with their operations . However , he had been released on DATE in an area near GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON Er made submissions to the offices of the governor and the public prosecutor in PERSON . He stated in his submissions that his brother PERSON Er had not been released , contrary to the information given to him by the PERSON public prosecutor on DATE . He added that he had tried unsuccessfully to find his brother in the surrounding villages and towns .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor initiated an investigation into PERSON disappearance and issued writs to the PERSON gendarmerie headquarters and PERSON commando headquarters requesting information about PERSON whereabouts . The public prosecutor reminded the military authorities that if PERSON was in their custody they needed to obtain official permission from the public prosecutor ’s office in order to keep him in detention .

CARDINAL . On DATE the commander of the PERSON gendarmerie headquarters , Captain S.A.U. , replied to the PERSON public prosecutor ’s letter and informed him that PERSON Er had not been detained at his headquarters . The village of PERSON had been evacuated for security reasons and it was therefore impossible to trace PERSON .

CARDINAL . Following the failure of the Çukurca commando headquarters to respond to his request for information , the PERSON public prosecutor repeated his request in a letter of CARDINAL DATE . The public prosecutor also referred to his telephone conversation with Major PERSON ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , and asked the commando headquarters to inform him exactly where PERSON Er had been released and whether there had been any eyewitnesses to the release .

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE a military officer from the GPE commando headquarters informed the public prosecutor that PERSON Er and “ his elderly relative ” had been taken from their village by soldiers on DATE to act as guides to the area . The CARDINAL men had helped the soldiers to locate a number of landmines in the area and had then “ left the soldiers at TIME ” DATE . No documents had been drawn up concerning the CARDINAL men as they had not been arrested or detained .

CARDINAL . On DATE a public prosecutor questioned the applicant PERSON , who repeated that his brother PERSON had been taken away from their village by soldiers on DATE . The gendarmerie first lieutenant who was with the soldiers had even slapped his brother in front of the villagers before taking him away . Following this incident the villagers had left the village DATE , but the applicant ’s elderly uncle , ORG , had stayed behind to wait for PERSON . The latter had returned to the village with the soldiers the same evening , very distraught . The soldiers had then taken both PERSON and ORG gendarmerie station , where they had tied them to a pole and left them until TIME . The CARDINAL men had also been beaten up . The following morning Hacı Mehrap Er and CARDINAL other villagers who had also been taken away by the soldiers had been released . According to his uncle , PERSON had been unconscious when he left him . Furthermore , PERSON , a fellow villager , had seen the applicant ’s brother being taken from ORG gendarmerie station to the commando unit in a military vehicle .
CARDINAL . NORP The public prosecutor summoned PERSON and PERSON to his office . On DATE PERSON told the public prosecutor that he had seen PERSON Er in a military vehicle , wearing handcuffs .

CARDINAL . On DATE Hacı Mehrap Er told the public prosecutor that on DATE of the incident the villagers had been preparing to leave their village as ordered by the military . However , some ORG members had heard about the evacuation and the presence of the soldiers in the village and had attacked the soldiers . During the armed clash that had ensued , PERSON had attempted to leave the village in order to find his son , who was out in the fields . However , the soldiers had misinterpreted PERSON intentions and had taken him to ORG gendarmerie station . Subsequently , ORG had also been taken to the same gendarmerie station , where he and PERSON had been tied to a pole and beaten up . The soldiers had also doused them with hot water . The bones in PERSON ’s feet had been broken with a stone . When Hacı PERSON was released the following morning , PERSON was being dragged along the ground by QUANTITY or QUANTITY soldiers . When he returned to the village , the soldiers had already burned it down .

CARDINAL . After making CARDINAL unsuccessful attempts to summon him to his office , the public prosecutor finally questioned Major PERSON of NORP commando headquarters on DATE . The major confirmed that he had heard that PERSON Er had been taken from the village by his soldiers on DATE to act as a guide to the area . After his telephone conversation with the public prosecutor he had ordered PERSON release . However , he had later found out that the person released on his orders was not PERSON Er . Major PERSON added that he did not know whether PERSON had been taken away by his soldiers .

CARDINAL . First Lieutenant H.Ö. , who was in charge of CARDINAL of the CARDINAL units of soldiers which had taken part in the operation on DATE , was questioned by the public prosecutor on DATE . The first lieutenant confirmed that he and his soldiers had gone to GPE village on DATE of the incident . Following an armed clash with members of the ORG , during which an officer had been killed and CARDINAL soldiers injured , they had seen PERSON Er running away from the village . A number of soldiers had then been sent to catch him . The soldiers had caught him and “ might have slapped him a few times ” because they believed that PERSON Er had been helping the ORG . PERSON Er had then helped the soldiers to find a number of landmines . On their way they had seen Hacı PERSON , who had asked permission to go with the soldiers . They had then taken PERSON ORG gendarmerie station . The first lieutenant had telephoned his superior officers at the battalion ’s headquarters and told them about the CARDINAL men . His superior officers had told them that it was not necessary to take the men to headquarters as there was no evidence against them . PERSON and ORG had spent TIME with the soldiers at Işıklı gendarmerie station . It was possible that the soldiers “ might have got angry with the CARDINAL men and slapped them ” but they had not tortured them or broken the bones in PERSON ’s feet as alleged . The following day the “ old man ” had been released outside the station and PERSON had been released some QUANTITY metres away from the station .
CARDINAL . First Lieutenant Ş.Ö. had been in charge of another unit on DATE of the incident . He gave a similar statement to the public prosecutor .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor questioned CARDINAL other gendarmerie officers who had taken part in the operation on DATE . The officers confirmed that they had taken PERSON Hacı Mehrap Er to Işıklı gendarmerie station but denied that they had ill - treated them . They maintained that the CARDINAL men had been released DATE and added that PERSON Er had even waved to them when he was being released . The officers also told the public prosecutor that it was possible that PERSON Er had subsequently joined the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor issued an instruction to find PERSON Er and asked to be given a progress report DATE . In his instruction the prosecutor stated that PERSON had not been arrested by the soldiers but had been taken by them to act as a guide to the area . He also stated that , since CARDINAL of PERSON sons had joined the ORG , it was possible that PERSON Er himself might also have joined .

CARDINAL . It appears from the documents that the police and soldiers searched unsuccessfully for PERSON Er and informed the public prosecutor at regular intervals until DATE . On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor requested the police to continue their search . After the prosecutor ’s letter the police continued to inform the prosecutor at twomonthly intervals about the unsuccessful search for PERSON Er .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant , PERSON , applied to the PERSON ORG of First Instance , alleging that his father had disappeared in life - threatening circumstances on DATE and that nothing had been heard from him since that date . He asked the court to issue a decree stating that his father was to be presumed dead . This request was accepted on CARDINAL DATE . On DATE custody of PERSON CARDINAL youngest children – the applicants Mr Hızır Er , Ms PERSON and Ms Belkısa Er – was awarded to their elder brother PERSON Er , who is also one of the applicants .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor issued a decision stating that , according to the allegations made and the information given to him by eyewitnesses , PERSON Er had last been seen in a military area , where he had been “ tortured by soldiers ” . Hence , the military were responsible for the incidents in question and the military prosecutor in the city of PERSON had jurisdiction to continue the investigation .

CARDINAL . The military prosecutor in PERSON began his investigation on DATE by requesting information from local military units about whether or not anything had been heard from PERSON Er and whether he had sons who were ORG members . He also asked for regular updates DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the military units informed the military prosecutor that , according to information obtained from intelligence officers , PERSON Er had been taken from his village by soldiers . Following his release on DATE , PERSON had gone to northern GPE to join the ORG . Nothing had been heard from him since DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the military prosecutor questioned the applicant PERSON , and ORG . Both men reiterated the information they had already provided to the PERSON public prosecutor .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants’ legal representative requested information from the PERSON public prosecutor about the investigation . He was informed of the transfer of the investigation to the military prosecutor ’s office in GPE .

CARDINAL . At regular intervals DATE and DATE CARDINAL identical copies of a document stating that PERSON Er had joined the ORG were signed by various military officers and sent to the PERSON military prosecutor in connection with his request of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the military prosecutor decided that he also lacked jurisdiction to investigate the disappearance . In his decision the prosecutor summarised the steps taken in the investigation and stated that on DATE PERSON Er had been acting suspiciously and had been taken away by soldiers . He had then been taken to various places where he had shown the soldiers explosives planted by members of the ORG . The soldiers had then taken him to the barracks . The military prosecutor concluded that , in taking PERSON Er to their barracks in order to question him , the soldiers had been carrying out judicial rather than military functions . Military prosecutors could only investigate offences committed by members of the armed forces in the performance of their military duties . Hence , the civilian prosecutors had jurisdiction to continue the investigation . The file was therefore sent back to the PERSON public prosecutor ’s office .
CARDINAL . The PERSON public prosecutor continued his investigation by instructing the gendarmes to continue to search for PERSON Er .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor summarised his investigation in a report . According to the report , on DATE PERSON Er had been acting suspiciously and had therefore been taken away by soldiers . He had then assisted the soldiers in locating CARDINAL landmines . He had stayed at the ORG gendarmerie station and had been “ released ” on DATE . According to “ secret investigations ” conducted by the gendarmes , PERSON Er had joined the ORG following his release . The PERSON public prosecutor concluded that the PERSON public prosecutor ’s office had jurisdiction to continue the investigation , and sent the investigation file there .
CARDINAL . On DATE a public prosecutor in the city of PERSON issued a search and arrest warrant for PERSON Er for the offence of membership of an illegal organisation , namely the ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP In response to an apparent query from the PERSON gendarmerie , the PERSON public prosecutor noted in a letter of DATE that the fact that PERSON Er ’s family had obtained a decree from a civil court presuming him to be dead did not mean that PERSON Er had indeed died . He decided that the search for PERSON Er should continue with a view to arresting him under the warrant of DATE .
CARDINAL . On subsequent dates the PERSON gendarmerie informed the PERSON public prosecutor that their efforts to find and arrest PERSON Er had been unsuccessful .
